Text.Value: Away, thrall. Enough distractions.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [LoganP] Anim of Balthazaar turning from his ritual pose to face the PLYR and blend with hsi next V.O line. Potentially *DUPE* of other cinematic greatting node in dailogue, depending on how well it blends.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar is interrupted from his necromancy by the player's intrusion and turns around to face them, annoyed
EditorData.SFXTags: [KB] Bubbling and necromancy casting on the blood-filled cauldron. Spell stops as he's interrupted [SG]
EditorData.VFXTags: [KB] Necromantic spell stops as he's interrupted [SG]

Text.Value: How often do I have to repeat myself? No disturbances.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [LoganP] Anim of Balthazaar turning from his ritual pose to face the PLYR and blend with hsi next V.O line.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar is interrupted from his necromancy by the player's intrusion and turns around to face them with hostility
EditorData.SFXTags: [KB] Bubbling and necromancy casting on the blood-filled cauldron. Spell stops as he's interrupted [SG]
EditorData.VFXTags: [KB] Necromantic spell stops as he's interrupted [SG]

Text.Value: General Thorm didn't inform me you were coming, which means you're trespassing.
No... there's far too much life in your eyes for you to be a thrall. But I can easily remedy that...
General Thorm to you, thrall. You should have told me you were meant for him from the beginning.
Stare vacantly, pretending to be a thrall.
Wait - you're no underling of mine. Far too intact for my tastes. That means you're a trespasser.
Wait... you're that treacherous drow that failed General Thorm. Minthara. Most kind of you to turn yourself in...
A misunderstanding, is it? Poor creature. But fear not - you'll be relieved of all such concerns, once I'm through with you...
Stare vacantly, pretending to be a thrall.
I need to find Ketheric Thorm.
Who...? Come now, do you know just how many children have been through here, in one form or another?
Now chop-chop. or I'll chop-chop.
Wait... You're that wretched Harper woman who's been interfering in General Thorm's plans. Jaheira. Most kind of you to turn yourself in...
Hold on - it's you. My little helper from the Nightsong's former home.
I can't be expected to remember every little morsel. But I do remember that you're supposed to be a thrall. Evidently not.

EditorData.NodeContext: Onto the player's ruse. Turns hostile at the end.

Text.Value: Seek out the nautiloid bay, descend the elevator, then the doorway that lies straight ahead. The general will be there.
Leave.
There was a tiefling child here - Mol. What did you do to her?
I come to serve.
Ah, my mistake. I should have known by your gormless demeanour. You've had your mind decluttered and have been put to work.

EditorData.NodeContext: Believing the player to be an enthralled slave

Text.Value: Just keep out of the way, thrall. I'm in the midst of a sensitive task.
Hold on - this is just a misunderstanding.
An admirable charade, but you overplayed your hand. No matter - you won't need any hands soon enough.

EditorData.NodeContext: Seeing through the player's lie. Attacks afterwards.

Text.Value: Well I didn't seek your service, did I?

EditorData.NodeContext: Peeved (believes the player to be an enthralled slave)

Text.Value: I admire the attempt, but your acting leaves something to be desired. I'll try to make something more useful from whatever parts of you survive undamaged.
Thralls don't make demands. But you're no thrall, are you?
I can't be expected to remember every little morsel. But I digress, trespasser.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismisses the thought before turning hostile

Text.Value: Attack.

Synopsis:
A player walked into Balthazar's chambers in the colony, while Balthazar is alive, and was spotted by him (or one of his undead). Balthazar reacts with hostility, but players can convince him that they have been turned into thralls.
This can only happen if Balthazar is alive at this point and you didn't try the Audience with the Absolute. If you did not send Nightsong to Ketheric, Balthazar would have died in combat in her prison.
This dialog will also play when interacting with Balthazar in this route.
